SourcedStatement: An average of two months passed between when Oakland schools were tested for lead this spring and when those school communities were notified of high lead levels in August, according to a report from this week’s Oakland Unified school board meeting.

Justification: The district’s risk management team began testing water fixtures and faucets in April and continued through the summer, but it wasn’t until Aug. 10 that district officials realized school sites hadn’t been told about it or informed of the results.
